title: Warsaw Ghetto Uprising commemorated on 80th anniversary
description: Presidents and Holocaust survivors and their descendants commemorated the 80th anniversary of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising on Wednesday with a poignant sense that the responsibility for carrying on the memory of the Holocaust is passing from the witnesses to younger generations.

title: Stranded fishermen rescued after days without food or water off Australia but 8 feared dead
description: Eight Indonesian fishermen are feared drowned and another 11 have been rescued after spending almost a week without food or water on a barren island off the northwest Australian coast in the wake of a powerful tropical cyclone, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Fighting erupts in Khartoum despite planned cease-fire
description: Fighting between forces loyal to dueling generals raged for a fifth day in Sudan, hours after a truce was supposed to have come into effect. The one-day humanitarian cease-fire was planned to bring a period of relief to millions of Sudanese trapped at home with dwindling supplies.

title: Video shows people using tied bedsheets to escape from a Beijing hospital fire
description: Dramatic cellphone video showed people using tied bedsheets to climb down the walls to escape smoke and flames after a fire broke out at a Beijing hospital.

title: Fishermen rescued after being stranded for six days on a barren island off Australia
description: A group of 11  Indonesian fishermen were rescued from a remote island off Western Australia after two fishing vessels were caught in a tropical cyclone. According to a statement from Australian Maritime Safety Authority, an aircraft was diverted to rescue the fishermen from Bedwell Island. They had been stranded for six days without food and water.

title: Fire kills more than two dozen patients in Beijing hospital
description: The death toll rose to 29 on Wednesday from a fire at a Beijing hospital that was one of the Chinese capital’s deadliest in at least two decades.

title: Kim Jong Un says North Korea’s 1st spy satellite is ready for launch
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said his country has built its first-ever military spy satellite and that he planned to launch it on an undisclosed date, state media reported Wednesday.

title: India to overtake China as the world’s most populous country by mid-2023, U.N. says
description: India is on its way to become the world’s most populous country, overtaking China with almost 3 million more people in the middle of this year, data released on Wednesday by the United Nations showed.
